incorporation_agency: Ohio Secretary of State - Business Services Division
charitable_registration_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with contributions under $25,000 annually that do not use professional fundraisers may be exempt from registration. Religious organizations and certain educational institutions are also exempt.

formation_requirements.notes: Ohio requires a statutory agent (registered agent) with a physical Ohio address. The agent can be an individual Ohio resident or a business entity authorized to do business in Ohio.

requirements.notes: Ohio is one of the few states that does NOT require annual corporate reports for nonprofit corporations. However, nonprofits must still file annual charitable organization reports with the Attorney General if registered.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
required_information: Copy of Articles of Incorporation or organizing documents
Copy of Bylaws or code of regulations
List of officers, directors, and trustees
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Registration is free and required before soliciting in Ohio. Organizations with contributions under $25,000 without professional fundraisers may be exempt but should confirm eligibility.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 6 months after fiscal year end
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Annual filing is free. Organizations with contributions under $25,000 may be exempt but many choose to file voluntarily. Late filing may result in compliance actions.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Apply after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form STEC 1 - Sales Tax Exemption Certificate Application
requirements.notes: Once approved, exemption certificate does not expire but should be updated if organization information changes. Exemption applies to purchases for charitable purposes. Provide certificate to vendors at time of purchase.

requirements.filing_agency: County Auditor and State Board of Tax Appeals
requirements.due_date_specifics: File by March 31st of the first year claiming exemption
requirements.form_number: Form DTE 24A - Application for Exemption of Real Property
required_information: Description of property use for exempt purposes
requirements.notes: Property must be owned by nonprofit and used exclusively for charitable purposes. Once granted, exemption continues if use remains charitable. Annual recertification may be required. Contact county auditor for specific requirements.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; renew annually
required_information: Proof of IRS 501(c)(3) status or other qualifying status
Proof of 2+ years operation in Ohio
List of officers and raffle operators
Statement that proceeds will benefit charitable purpose
requirements.notes: Ohio raffle license is free and valid for calendar year. Organization must be in existence for 2+ years. No limit on number of raffles per year. Net proceeds must be used for charitable purposes.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; renew annually
required_information: Proof of IRS 501(c)(3) or other qualifying status
Proof of 2+ years operation in Ohio
List of officers and bingo operators
requirements.notes: Ohio charitable bingo requires annual license and quarterly financial reports. Organization must be in existence for 2+ years. Proceeds must benefit charitable purposes. Strict rules on prize amounts and operations.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional solicitors who solicit on behalf of charities. Each campaign must be registered with Form PS-2. Bond must remain in effect throughout registration period.

requirements.filing_agency: Ohio Attorney General - Charitable Law Section
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting but does not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed within 10 days of execution.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and included in CHAR-2 filing if required
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 180 days after fiscal year end (completed before CHAR-2 due date)
requirements.notes: Ohio requires audited financial statements for organizations with contributions over $500,000. Organizations between $100,000-$500,000 must have financial review or compilation. Organizations under $100,000 may file internally prepared statements. Audit must be performed by independent CPA.

special_notes.no_annual_corporate_report: Ohio does NOT require annual corporate reports for nonprofit corporations with the Secretary of State, making it unique among states. However, charitable organization annual reports ARE required with the Attorney General.
special_notes.free_registration: Ohio's charitable registration and annual reporting are free, though professional fundraiser and bingo licenses have fees. Raffle licenses are also free.
special_notes.board_requirements: Ohio nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Ohio residents. Board must meet requirements specified in code of regulations (bylaws).
special_notes.two_year_gaming_rule: Ohio gaming laws require organizations to be in existence for at least 2 years before conducting raffles, bingo, or other charitable gaming. This is shorter than some states but still a significant requirement.
special_notes.raffle_flexibility: Unlike many states, Ohio does not limit the number of raffles per year or impose strict prize limits for raffles, making it relatively friendly for charitable raffle operations.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying activities. Ohio law reinforces these federal limits.
special_notes.professional_solicitor_disclosure: Professional solicitors must make specific disclosures to donors including that they are paid solicitors, the charity's name, and how to contact the charity directly.
special_notes.bingo_reporting: Organizations conducting charitable bingo must file quarterly financial reports (Form BINGO-2) in addition to the annual CHAR-2 report. Bingo operations are heavily regulated.
special_notes.audit_threshold: Ohio audit threshold is $500,000 in contributions, which is mid-to-high compared to other states. Review/compilation required for $100,000-$500,000.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes. Attorney General should be notified of dissolution plans.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and Ohio Corporate or Pass-Through Entity Tax returns if conducting business in Ohio.
special_notes.online_filing_system: Ohio has a modern online filing system for charitable registration, annual reports, and professional fundraiser registration, making compliance more efficient.
special_notes.property_tax_exclusive_use: Ohio property tax exemption requires exclusive charitable use. Any non-exempt use of property may disqualify the exemption for the entire property or proportionally.
